GTgen
  • Random Graph and Timeserie Generation
  • View page source

Random Graph and Timeserie Generation

  • There are two pipelines to generate random graphs and random timeseries implemented.

  • The first one takes input from real data (weights and node degree sequence), and generates an uniformly randomly picked graph with anomalies that keeps the weights and node degree sequence from the input. To generate a timeserie from real data (set of timestamps and values at these timestamps), we “shuffle” the values of the timeserie.

  • The second pipeline generates graphs with anomaly from scratch, using Erdos-Renyi models for the ‘normal graph’ and the ‘anomalies’. To generate the timeserie we generate a white noise.
